alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County; Quay County; Roosevelt County; South Central Highlands; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 22 at 2:38PM MST until January 24 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches possible. Isolated amounts as high as 8 inches are possible. * WHERE...Central Highlands, Eastern Lincoln County, South Central Highlands, Curry County, De Baca County, Guadalupe County, Quay County, Roosevelt County, and Southwest Chaves County. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winter travel impacts are likely along Interstate 40 and U.S. Highways 54, 60, 70, 84, and 285 through eastern NM.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County; Quay County; Roosevelt County; South Central Highlands; Southwest Chaves County
